Go Newsletter
Issue 120 — July 28, 2016

It's been a bit of a slim week for things to pick for the newsletter this week - everyone in the Northern Hemisphere must be enjoying summer :-) The good news, then, is if you have a Go project, library, news, or tutorial to share, hit reply and we'll try our best to include it next week.

Featured
GAS: A Go AST Scanner   tools 
Inspects source code for security problems by scanning the Go AST and matching results against a set of predefined ‘rules’.
Hewlett Packard Enterprise
go-dotnet: Go Wrapper for the .NET Core Runtime   tools 
A proof of concept. Can help you load and run .NET EXEs or load DLLS, setup delegates, and call them from Go functions.
Matias Insaurralde
Scott Mansfield Talking About Using Go at Netflix   podcast 
An hour long podcast with Scott Mansfield who talks about Go at Netflix, performance, latency and caching, Rend (their memcached proxy), and more.
The Changelog
Point logs from logrus, go-logging, go-log, log15, or text files at Papertrail
Get a flight data recorder for your apps and systems. Papertrail supports the same RFC-defined protocols that every Go logging library does, so capturing output is painless. Or, already logging to files? Use our tiny Go-based file watcher daemon.
Papertrail   sponsored 
Go Enters IEEE's Top Programming Languages in 2016   news 
Go comes in as IEEE Spectrum's 10th top language for 2016.
IEEE Spectrum
Jobs
Stop wasting time - know what you'll earn before the interview
On Hired, sign up in 10 minutes and get offers from top companies like GitHub, Uber, & Stripe. Engineers get an average of 5 offers on the platform in 1 week
Hired.​com

Announcing Go 1.6 Support for Amazon Linux   news

google.​com
Generating Secure Random Numbers Using crypto/rand   tutorial 
Matt Silverlock
A Look At Some of Go's Subtleties Regarding The Use of Interfaces   tutorial

Modifying A Go Slice In-Place During Iteration   tutorial 
Paul Smith
Accelerating SHA256 by 100x in Go on ARM   story 
The 64-bit ARMv8 core has introduced new instructions for SHA1 and SHA2 acceleration.
Frank Wessels
On The Memory Alignment of Go Slice Values   story 
Go’s slices are not aligned to a 32-byte boundary. Here’s a description of the alignment issue and two devised solutions.
Xuanyi Chew
Automate your Go app delivery with Shippable   tools 
With Shippable automate your Go app delivery pipelines, with flexibility to work with your existing setup. Plans from $0, no CC required.
Shippable   sponsored 
Building Web Pages using The html/template Package   video 
Aaron Schlesinger
Implementing Virtual Machines in Go and C   video 
InfoQ
gocelery: Celery Distributed Task Queue in Go   code 
Celery is a popular task queue in the Python world.
Sick Yoon
orgalorg: Parallel SSH Command Executioner and File Synchronization Tool   code 
reconquest
pokevision-cli: A CLI Interface for the PokeVision API   code 
Go(tta) catch em all..
Jacob Marshall
Correlate app performance with runtime metrics   tools 
Datadog makes it simple to graph custom metrics from your Go apps alongside memory and GC stats from expvar.
Datadog   sponsored
